title: K6 Passwords.
content: Is there a site or way I can get a page with the creatures in like a text doc?

title: Re: K6 Passwords.
content: IIRC theres only one way that you need a password... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pirate.gif[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: K6 Passwords.
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pogo.gif[/img] Why do you need them eh?

Well you can download Xtraverse's patch to upgrade to V1.4 of keen6, which doesnt require character names...

Its stickied on the top of the official games thread[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img]

title: or
content: I believe [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/enemies/enemies-k6.html]CC314[/url] has what you need.  :-)

title: Re: or
content: The enemies are selected in random order, I suppose, so a list of them can't be really made (that what would come after a fleex etc..). But it's easy to learn those names. There are dozen sites having the names.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: or
content: So the pirated version aren't the only ones that need passwords? I have no idea anymore. I wish i had keen 6... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: or
content: Version 1.0 of Keen 6 asks "password"..You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: or
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr] So the pirated version aren't the only ones that need passwords?[hr][/quote]
All copies of a password-asking version of Keen 6 ask for a "password" (not really, they ask you to identify a creature).

The clue is that if you have a non-pirated version, you also have the official manual, which lists the name of all creatures, whereas if you have a pirated version, ID expects you to be completely ignorant of enemy names.

title: also
content: Also, some pirated versions come with a Keen6.COM file, in addition to the Keen6.EXE file, which bypasses the copyright protection and starts the game as Keen4/5 would.
